thread.title: Trump to ask for major cuts to EPA, increased spending for military - The Boston Globe
thread.title_full: Trump to ask for major cuts to EPA, increased spending for military - The Boston Globe

author: Glenn Thrush
title: Trump to ask for major cuts to EPA, increased spending for military - The Boston Globe
text:
Already a subscriber? Members Sign In Trump to ask for major cuts to EPA, increased spending for military President Donald Trump at the White House earlier this week. By Glenn Thrush and Kate Kelly New York Times February 27, 2017 
WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump will instruct federal agencies Monday to assemble a budget for the coming fiscal year that would include sharp increases in Defense Department spending; major cuts to other agencies, including the Environmental Protection Agency; and no reductions to the largest entitlement programs, Social Security and Medicare, according to four senior administration officials. 
The outline, drafted by the Office of Management and Budget director, Mick Mulvaney, is the first volley to the federal agencies. Departments will have several days to comment on the plan, and congressional leaders will be alerted before Trump’s speech to a joint session of Congress Tuesday night. Advertisement 
In putting together their budget plans, White House officials are operating under the assumption that the rate of the United States’ economic growth this year will be 2.4 percent, slightly ahead of current projects but well below the 3 percent growth that Trump promised during the campaign, according to one person who has been briefed on the matter. 
For next year, the operating assumption is only slightly higher, that person added. You're reading 1 of 5 free articles.
